title.narrative: Deep Dive Conference (8/11 2021) - Conference where relevant national and global stakeholders will meet, discuss and commit to ways forward to ensure better digital mobilization, resilience and responsibility. - The setup at the conference will be centered around topics of digital mobilization, resilience and responsibility - The content will be based on findings and solutions from actors from the Global South on how tech is an enabler for democracy rather than the contrary. Concrete solutions will be sought from the start of this project in working groups, surveys and dialogue with relevant people, such as digital defenders, from the Global South and other international experts.
In person conference in Copenhagen where results of activities will be presented and next steps will be agreed on and committed to

Through engaging online dialogue, stakeholders from around the world will be sharing solutions and suggest next steps for both civil society, the tech industry and governments. The Virtual Days of Engagement will involve participants from a diverse large group of people from across the world. It will include dialogue around initiatives piloted in this project but also initiatives by other stakeholders around the world that could be relevant to highlight and feature at the conference. There will be a preference to speakers and solutions from the Global South to ensure that end users and those at the frontline of attacks are the ones steering the dialogue and recommendations. This will be organized by Global Focus in collaboration with members, their partners in the Global South, international stakeholders and relevant frontrunners from around the world. It will center around deriving concrete outcomes that will frame the dialogue and solutions at the conference.
Increased use of tech as an enabler for democracy rather than the contrary through better digital mobilization, resilience and responsibility.
Concrete political and practical solutions for digital mobilization, resilience and responsibility are presented at the conference, committed to by various stakeholders and tested in pilot projects

target.value:
Activities launched addressing digital responsibility, mobilization and resilience as described in outputs 1-6

title.narrative: Digital resilience, mobilisation and engagement Action Aid Danmark / Mellemfolkelig Samvirke 1. New tactics on digital security. Pilot project on digital security with young activists in partnership with Digital Defenders Partnership to propose tangible solutions, support, and build young people’s digital resilience. The project is seen as a first step towards assessing solutions already available to inform what efforts should go into digital security initiatives moving forward. 2. Technology as a driver for social change. Tech events at ActionAid Global Platforms. The purpose is to bring young people and other subject matter experts together in talks about the strategic use of technology in advocacy, organizing and governance work. The aim is to identify best local practises as building blocks to inform ActionAid’s ongoing work within this area. 3. The creation of a window under the GF capacity pool to seek funding for small-scale pilot projects that will also run into 2022

title.narrative: Digital responsibility Danish Institute for Human Rights (DIHR) Civil society analysis: Tech for Democracy focusing on digital responsibility and mobilization especially ensuring trends and solutions identified by Global South voices (GF) #UNmute civil society campaign to ensure meaningful virtual participation by citizens around the world at UN meetings (GF) Engagement and dialogue with European companies and States on a digital transition with respect for human rights with a particular focus on operations that links to countries in the Global South and civil society in these countries. This will be done in coordination with the Danish Tech embassy. Engagement and dialogue with primarily European institutional investors on managing digital rights risks in their portfolios with a particular focus on investments with links to developing countries. African NHRI Alliance that pledges to protect and promote a culture of respect for digital rights.
